benchmark_details.name: Information Updation
benchmark_details.overview: The Information Updation dataset simulates the task of updating outdated Wikipedia tables with the latest versions across multiple languages, specifically focusing on enhancing coherence and accuracy in information synchronization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the Information Updation dataset is to improve the synchronization of information across multilingual Wikipedia tables and enhance the accuracy and coherence of updates.

data.source: Wikipedia tables consisting of outdated and updated versions sampled over time.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by human annotators ensuring accuracy.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the alignment and quality of updates produced by the model involved in the Information Updation task.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 Score indicates better model performance in accurately updating the information, with close alignment to the ground truth tables.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is validated through human annotations and comparative evaluations between models.
